alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued June 14 at 2:17PM MDT until June 15 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow for elevations above 5000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 5 and 15 inches for elevations above 5000 ft Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Snowfall in the high country can quickly lead to slush or snow covered routes, especially over Marias Pass. The cold and snow could also lead to dangerous conditions for those outdoors. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to snow-loaded trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The National Weather Service recommends that those who are recreating in the back country, especially those who are not prepared for winter conditions, should move to lower elevations.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
